fn.p: Developing Arctic Modelling and Observing Capabilities for Long-term Environmental Studies, Framework Programme (FP) 6.
Arctic Tipping Points, FP7. See Ambio special issue: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s13280-011-0230-9.
The French combined Ice, Atmosphere, Arctic Ocean Observing System buoys (Gascard 2012).
More details and additional references on this particular topic are available in the electronic supplementary material to Crépin et al. ( 2017).
Carbon intensive activities instead of investing in clean production tend to move to countries with low carbon price.

See for example Ciccarelli (2014) “Warming up to Arctic Prospects” Washington Post, 5th of June 2014 or Struzik (2016) “Shipping Plans Grow as Arctic Ice Fades” Yale Environment 360, 17th of November 2016.

There are two routes namely the Northern Sea Route (NSR) along the Arctic Coast of Russia from Kara Gate to Bering Strait and the Northwest Passage (NWP) from Bering Strait through the Canadian Archipelago to Baffin Bay.
Based on United Nations Comtrade data which does not include Taiwan.

The information from this section was collected during an ACCESS workshop, from the ACCESS newsletter nr. 10 ( http://access-eu.org/en/publications/access_newsletter.html), and an unpublished ‘ACCESS synthesis’ manuscript.
Meeting on high seas fisheries in the central Arctic Ocean: chairman’s statement: https://www.state.gov/e/oes/ocns/opa/rls/269126.htm retrieved 7 September 2017.

During August 2017, a Russian-owned tanker, built for Arctic conditions completed a journey in record time from Europe to Asia, for the first time without ice-breaker (New York Times, 25 August 2017).
International Network for Terrestrial Research and Monitoring in the Arctic, European Union project, http://www.eu-interact.org/, retrieved 18 August 2017.
